data.title: John Galsworthy – Bibliography
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1932 was awarded to John Galsworthy "for his distinguished art of narration which takes its highest form in The Forsyte Saga"
data.text: Selected works From the Four Winds. – London : Unwin, 1897. – (as John Sinjohn) Jocelyn. – London : Duckworth, 1898. – (as John Sinjohn) Villa Rubein. – London : Duckworth, 1900. – (as John Sinjohn) A Man of Devon. – London : Blackwood, 1901. – (as John Sinjohn) The Island Pharisees. – London : Heinemann, 1904 The Man of Property. – London : Heinemann, 1906 The Country House. – London : Heinemann, 1907 A Commentary. – London : Richards, 1908 Fraternity. – London : Heinemann, 1909 Plays : The Silver Box ; Joy; Strife. – London : Duckworth, 1909 Justice : a Tragedy in Four Acts. – London : Duckworth, 1910 A Motley. – London : Heinemann, 1910 The Patrician. – London : Heinemann, 1911 The Little Dream : An Allegory in Six Scenes. – London : Duckworth, 1911 The Pigeon : a Fantasy in Three Acts. – London : Duckworth, 1912 Moods, Songs, and Doggerels. – London : Heinemann, 1912 For Love of Beasts. – London : Animals’ Friend Society, 1912 The Inn of Tranquility : Studies and Essays. – London : Heinemann, 1912 The Eldest Son : a Domestic Drama in Three Acts. – London : Duckworth, 1912 The Fugitive : a Play in Four Acts. – London : Duckworth, 1913 The Dark Flower. – London : Heinemann, 1913 The Mob : a Play in Four Acts. – London : Duckworth, 1914 Memories. – London : Heinemann, 1914 Some Slings and Arrows / edited by Elsie E.
